Module com.example.project4software_methodology
Package com.example.project4software_methodology

Class CurrentOrderController

java.lang.Object
com.example.project4software_methodology.CurrentOrderController
public class CurrentOrderController extends Object
Controller class for managing the current order in the RUPizza JavaFX application. This class handles the display and manipulation of the current pizza order, including adding or removing pizzas and calculating the total price.
Author:
Rohan Parikh & Ganesh Konda

  • Constructor Details

    • CurrentOrderController

      public CurrentOrderController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller. This method sets up the initial state of the current order view and refreshes the order list.

    • refreshOrderList

      public void refreshOrderList()
      Refreshes the pizza list in the current order. Clears the existing list and adds all pizzas from the current order instance.

    • updateOrderView

      private void updateOrderView()
      Updates the order view with details like order number and pricing. Clears the pizza list view and sets text fields for order details.

    • handleRemovePizza

      private void handleRemovePizza()
      Handles the action of removing a selected pizza from the order. Removes the selected pizza from the current order and updates the UI.

    • handlePlaceOrder

      private void handlePlaceOrder()
      Handles the action of placing the current order. Adds the current order to the store orders if it is not empty and resets the view.

    • resetOrderView

      private void resetOrderView()
      Resets the order view to its default state. Clears the pizza list view and resets all text fields.

    • showWarning

      private void showWarning(String message)
      Displays a error message in a dialog box.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to be displayed.

    • showInformation

      private void showInformation(String message)
      Displays a success message in a dialog box.
      Parameters:
      message - The success message to be displayed.
